name: Vehicle Simulator
description: Vehicle Simulator is an open world flying/sailing simulator with accurate physics and dynamics, simulating well the various boats, planes and land vehicles included. The game allows the user to modify and experiment with scenery making and vehicle design by way of extreme modability, with a large library of existing mods and add-ons.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: Intel Pentium 4 2.0 GHz, Intel Core 2.0 GHz, AMD Athlon 2000 or better Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB DirectX: Version 9.0c Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 500 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c Compatible

reviews.review_text: I got a key after i got the game refunded because i couldn't get it working.    I found this game and really wanted to try it at first sight, and with only ten dollars i went digging through my room and found ten more and bought the game. I downloaded all the DLC and started it, but Steam froze and i thought 'this is what is supposed to happen.'. I got tired of waiting for it to start right up and closed Steam because it was still frozen. After opening Steam again i tried to start the game again only to get a message saying the game was already running. Confused, i went into my task manager and found the processes running. I tried to close them but i couldn't without restarting my pc. I kept trying after receiving Developer support and i decided to get a refund.   A few days after this, i reveived a message from a developer asking for help with getting the game working, and i accepted their generous key and downloaded the game. I started it up and to my suprise it worked right away, and after it worked i installed all the DLC, and they worked too.   Im not sure how it happened, or if they released an update, but i love the game!   Thanks to the devs for being so nice and helping me even when they couldn't!  I would totally recommend this to anybody who loves simulators!
The game seemed to be an ok simulator, if it ran for more than 5 minutes without crashing. Returned.
